children.name: sad
children.definition: /sæd/  not happy, especially because a happy time has ended, or because you feel sorry about someone else’s unhappiness:buồn, không vui
examples: ▪ she felt sad as she waved goodbye.cô ấy cảm thấy buồn khi vẫy tay chào tạm biệt
▪ don’t look so sad! it won’t be long until the next holidays.đừng buồn như vậy! ngày lễ tiếp theo sẽ sớm đến thôi
▪ there was such a sad look in her eyes.trong mắt của cô ấy có một ánh nhìn buồn bã
sad to see/hear/learn etc buồn khi thấy/nghe/biết được
▪ we were very sad to hear about mrs humphrey’s death.chúng tôi rất buồn khi nghe tin bà humphrey mất.
sad to do something: buồn khi làm điều gì đó
▪ i was glad to be going home, but sad to leave all my friends.
sad about: buồn về
▪ it’s natural to feel sad about it when your children finally leave home.tự nhiên cảm thấy buồn khi đứa con cuối cùng rời khỏi nhà.
sadly[adverb]một cách buồn bã
▪ she shook her head sadly and sighed.cô lắc đầu buồn bã và thở dài

children.name: unhappy
children.definition: /ʌnˈhæpi/  not happy, because you are in a situation, job, or relationship that you do not enjoy at all, and it seems likely to continue:không vui
examples: ▪ neil was very unhappy at school.neil rất không vui về trường học.
▪ her parents’ divorce left her feeling confused and unhappyviệc li hôn của ba mẹ cô ấy khiến cô ấy bối rối và không vui.
desperately/deeply unhappy: tuyệt vọng
very unhappy
▪ she was desperately unhappy after sean left her.
unhappy about: không vui về
▪ i felt so unhappy about what he had said that i just sat down and cried.
unhappily[adverb] :một cách không vui
▪ ‘i really don’t know what to do’ said james, unhappily."

children.name: upset
children.definition: /ʌpˈset/  unhappy because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened, so that you feel shocked or you want to cry:buồn nản
examples: ▪ don’t be upset. i’m sure she didn’t mean to be unkind.
▪ the children were very upset when we told them that we wouldn’t be going to disneyland.
get upset: buồn
▪ we’d better not tell mum about what’s happened. she’ll only get upset.
upset about: buồn về
▪ liz is very upset about her uncle’s death.liz rất buồn về cái chết của chú mình
upset that: buồn bã rằng
▪ ‘what’s the matter with rod?’ ‘i think he’s still upset that we forgot his birthday.

children.name: miserable
children.definition: /ˈmɪzərəbəl/  extremely unhappy, because of the situation you are in, especially because you are lonely, hungry, cold etc:buồn
examples: ▪ he sat all alone in his room, thoroughly miserable.
▪ the poor miserable animals were starving, dirty and wet.
▪ all the staff seemed to look miserable and the atmosphere was not at all pleasant.
miserably[adverb]một cách khốn khổ
▪ he shook his head miserably, the tears pouring down his cheeksanh ta lắc đầu một cách thảm hại, những giọt nước mắt chảy xuống má anh ấy.

children.name: homesick
children.definition: /ˈhəʊmˌsɪk/  unhappy because you are away from your home, your family, and your friends, and you wish you were back there:nhớ nhà
examples: ▪ my sister was very homesick when she first went to college.
▪ they were both gazing out of the window like a couple of homesick kids.
▪ most people get homesick the first time they leave home.
homesick for: nhớ nhà
▪ sampras confessed that he was homesick for america after five weeks in europe.

children.name: dejected
children.definition: /dɪˈdʒektɪd, dɪˈdʒektəd/  sad and disappointed because something you hoped for did not happen - use this especially when this is shown in the way that someone looks, sounds etc:buồn chán, chán nản
examples: ▪ he looked utterly dejected when she told him he’d failed again.
▪ greg sounded dejected. ‘anything wrong?’ i said.
▪ one glance at the doctor’s dejected expression answered my question.
▪ kirkwood was a particularly dejected figure after their defeat.
dejectedly[adverb]một cách chán nản
▪ she read the letter and looked up dejectedly.

children.name: downcast
children.definition: /ˈdaʊnkɑːstǁ-kæst/  sad or disappointed because of a situation or because something you hoped for did not happen:chán nản, thất vọng
examples: ▪ jamie seems very downcast at the moment. he misses jenny terribly.jamie dường như rất chán nản vào lúc này. anh nhớ jenny một cách khủng khiếp.
▪ ‘you mustn’t be downcast’ he said. ‘you can always try again’
▪ the photograph of her sitting on her own made her look lonely and downcast.

children.name: glum/gloomy
children.definition: /glʌm, ˈgluːmi/  informal sad because something slightly bad has happened or you do not have much hope for the future:buồn
examples: ▪ don’t look so glum! things aren’t as bad as all that.▪ monday morning? feeling glum ?
▪ sorry to be gloomy. i’ve had a bit of a bad day.
▪ the doctor was a tall gloomy scotsman.
▪ the glum expression on the england manager’s face said it all.
▪ why are you in such a gloomy mood?
glumly/gloomily[adverb]một cách buồn bã, ảm đảm
▪ ‘raining again,’ she said glumly."mưa lại rồi" cô nói cộc lốc

children.name: wistful
children.definition: /ˈwɪstfəl/  someone who looks wistful has a slightly sad and thoughtful expression on their face, especially because they are thinking about the past or want something they cannot have:buồn
examples: ▪ simon’s face grew wistful as he thought about his happy student days.
▪ she looked at them with a wistful smile. ‘i wish i could go with you.’
wistfully[adverb]một cách buồn bã
▪ ‘we used to have lovely family holidays all together,’ she said wistfully."

children.name: mournful
children.definition: /ˈmɔːʳnfəl/  looking or sounding very sad, as if something very bad has happened:buồn
examples: ▪ his voice sounded so mournful that tears came into her eyes.
▪ i could hear the slow, mournful music of the bagpipes.
▪ the dog lay at his feet, looking up from time to time with big mournful eyes.
mournfully[adverb]buồn bã
▪ in the distance, a wolf howled mournfully.

children.name: feeling sad or unhappy for a long time
depressed
children.definition: /dɪˈprest/  very unhappy and without any hope for a long time, and feeling that your life will never get better, sometimes so that this becomes a mental illness:chán nản
examples: ▪ my sister’s been really depressed since she lost her job.em gái của tôi đã thực sự chán nản kể từ khi cô ấy mất việc làm.
▪ a lot of people get depressed in the winter, when the weather’s bad and there’s very little sunlight.rất nhiều người bị trầm cảm vào mùa đông, khi thời tiết xấu và có ít ánh sáng mặt trời.
depressed about chán nản về
▪ greta often gets depressed about her weight.

children.name: down/low
children.definition: /daʊn, ləʊ/  informal unhappy, especially because something bad has happened to you and you cannot see how to make the situation better:không vui
examples: ▪ john’s pretty low at the moment -- his business is losing money.
▪ he’s been feeling down since he failed his driving test for the fifth time

children.name: down in the dumps
children.definition: /ˌdaʊn ɪn ðə ˈdʌmps/  informal feeling unhappy and not having much interest in what is happening around you, but usually in a way that is not very serious:cảm thấy không vui
examples: ▪ mom’s kind of down in the dumps at the moment -- why don’t you buy her something to cheer her up?
▪ if you’re feeling down in the dumps, come over and have a chat.

children.name: feel blue
children.definition: /ˌfiːl ˈbluː/  informal to feel slightly sad or unhappy, because something bad has happened to you or sometimes for no particular reason:buồn
examples: ▪ feeling blue? don’t know who to talk to? phone depression hotline, 24 hours a day.

children.name: morose
children.definition: /məˈrəʊs/  someone who is morose behaves in an unhappy, bad-tempered way, and does not speak much to other people:buồn rầu
examples: ▪ since the accident she’s been morose and moody.
▪ frank was sitting alone at the table, looking morose.
▪ some people become morose and depressed when they first retire.một số người trở nên mệt mỏi và chán nản khi họ nghỉ hưu

children.name: heartbroken
children.definition: /ˈhɑːʳtˌbrəʊkən/  extremely sad and sorry because something very bad has happened, especially to someone or something that you love or care about very much:tồi tệ, đau lòng
examples: ▪ when her parents separated, she was heartbroken.
▪ heartbroken fans camped outside his house in beverly hills.
heartbroken at/about: đau lòng về
▪ mr and mrs dudley were heartbroken at having to leave the home where they had lived for thirty years.

children.name: devastated
children.definition: /ˈdevəsteɪtɪd, ˈdevəsteɪtəd/  extremely sad and shocked because something very bad has happened, and you feel that this has ruined your life or your plans:cực kì buồn rầu
examples: ▪ the whole town was devastated by the tragedy, in which fourteen schoolchildren died.
devastated to hear/find etc something: rất buồn khi nghe/tìm thấy cái gì
▪ when we got back, we were devastated to find that the house had been burgled, and everything of value taken.

children.name: inconsolable
children.definition: /ˌɪnkənˈsəʊləbəl/  so sad that other people cannot make you feel happier, especially because someone has died or because something very bad has happened:không thể nguôi ngoai
examples: ▪ after the death of her baby she was inconsolable.
▪ doris was inconsolable. how could her husband walk out on her like that?

children.name: sad
children.definition: /sæd/  use this about a story, piece of music, period of time etc that makes you feel sad:buồn
examples: sad time/day/moment/occasion etc thời gian buồn/ ngày/ giờ/dịp vv
▪ the day her son left home was one of the saddest days of her life.ngày con trai cô rời khỏi nhà là một trong những ngày buồn nhất của cuộc đời cô
sad news/story/song etc tin buồn/ câu chuyện/ bài hát buồn vv
▪ fairuz sang a sad song that made us all feel homesick.fairuz đã hát một bài hát buồn khiến tất cả chúng ta cảm thấy nhớ nhà.
▪ i don’t like movies with sad endings.tôi không thích những bộ phim có kết thúc buồn.
it is sad that: buồn là
▪ it’s very sad that she died before her children grew up.rất buồn khi cô ấy qua đời trước khi những đứa con lớn lên.

children.name: unhappy
children.definition: /ʌnˈhæpi/ không hạnh phúc
examples: unhappy childhood/marriage/year etc: thời thơ ấu không hạnh phúc/cuộc hôn nhân không hạnh phúc/năm tháng không hạnh phúc
a time when you are unhappy because you are in a difficult or unpleasant situation:
▪ phil was married for three unhappy years.
▪ looking at that photo always bring back unhappy memories.
▪ an unhappy love affair

children.name: depressing
children.definition: /dɪˈpresɪŋ/  a depressing experience, story, piece of news etc makes you feel that there is nothing to be happy about and not much hope for the future:buồn rầu, phiền muộn
examples: ▪ the deerhunter was a very depressing movie about vietnam.
▪ it’s such a depressing town - it’s full of ugly, disused factories.
▪ listening to the news can be really depressing, when all you ever hear about is violence and crime.

children.name: upsetting
children.definition: /ʌpˈsetɪŋ/  an upsetting experience or event makes you feel very sad and often shocked:sự khó chịu, buồn rầu
examples: ▪ seeing her lying there in a hospital bed was a very upsetting experience.
▪ she can’t talk about her son’s death - she finds it too upsetting.c
it is upsetting to find/know/learn etc something khó chịu khi tìm/ biết/ tìm hiểu
▪ it’s very upsetting to arrive home and find that your house has been burgled.

children.name: miserable
children.definition: /ˈmɪzərəbəl/  a time that is miserable is one when you are extremely unhappy because you are in a very unpleasant situation:khó chịu, buồn khổ
examples: ▪ factory workers during the 18th century led miserable lives.
▪ the journey home was miserable. everyone was depressed about losing the game.

children.name: heartbreaking/heart-rending
children.definition: /ˈhɑːʳtˌbreɪkɪŋ, ˈhɑːʳt ˌrendɪŋ/  a story, event, piece of news etc that is heartbreaking makes you feel extremely sad and sorry or extremely disappointed:đau khổ, đau lòng
examples: ▪ it’s a heartbreaking moment when a great sportsman finally decides that it’s time to quit.
▪ the decision to kill the infected animals was a heart-rending one for farmers.
it is heartbreaking to see/learn etc something: đau lòng khi làm gì
▪ having worked so hard to start the business, it would be heartbreaking to see it all collapse.

children.name: dismal
children.definition: /ˈdɪzməl/  a dismal place, situation, or time makes you feel unhappy and not at all hopeful:không hạnh phúc, ảm đảm
examples: ▪ it was a grey, dismal november afternoon.đó là một buổi chiều tháng mười xanh xám, ảm đạm.
▪ melinda joined her husband in moscow, but soon found life there bleak and dismal.
▪ the profit margin on hardware sales for the first quarter was a dismal 29%.
dismally[adverb]một cách ảm đạm
▪ at the time there was a dismally weak market in the rest of europe. vào thời điểm đó thị trường còn yếu ở châu âu.

children.name: dreary
children.definition: /ˈdrɪəri/  a place, activity, or time that is dreary is not at all interesting or enjoyable and makes you feel unhappy:không vui, ảm đạm
examples: ▪ this room is so dreary. how can we brighten it up?
▪ a dreary winter’s daymột ngày mùa đông ảm đạm.
▪ cooking for one person can be a dreary business, as many elderly people find.

children.name: bleak
children.definition: /bliːk/  a place or situation that is bleak is one in which there is nothing to make you feel cheerful or hopeful about the future:ảm đạm
examples: ▪ the wild landscape was bleak and bare.
▪ he gazed around the empty, bleak little room in despair.anh nhìn chằm chằm vào căn phòng nhỏ trống rỗng, ảm đạm đầy thất vọng.
▪ many people were facing a financially bleak christmas.nhiều người đang đối mặt với một giáng sinh ảm đạm về mặt tài chính.
▪ the chief executive said that the company was looking at a bleak future.giám đốc điều hành nói rằng côn ty đang có một tương lai ảm đạm.
the outlook/prospect/future etc is bleak: quang cảnh/viễn cảnh/tương lai ảm đạm
▪ prospects of success looked bleak as the opposition scored the first two goals..

children.name: make sb (feel) sad/unhappy
children.definition: make somebody (feel) sad/unhappy/ˌmeɪk somebody (fiːl) ˈsæd, ʌnˈhæpi/ làm cho ai đó cảm thấy buồn không vui
examples: ▪ something at school was making her unhappy, but she didn’t want to talk about it.
it makes somebody sad/unhappy to do something: làm cho ai đó thấy buồn
▪ it made me sad to see her looking so old and ill.nó khiến tôi buồn khi nhìn thấy cô ấy trông già nua và ốm yếu

children.name: upset
children.definition: /ʌpˈset/  to make someone feel sad and want to cry:buồn rầu
examples: ▪ i’m sorry if i upset you - i didn’t mean to.
▪ the idea of having to change school seemed to upset him more than we thought it would.
it upsets somebody to do something: ai đó cảm thấy buồn khi làm gì
▪ her father died when she was ten, and it still upsets her to think about it.

children.name: sadden
children.definition: /ˈsædn/  if a situation or event saddens someone, it makes them feel sad, especially because they think that this type of situation or event should not happen:làm buồn rầu
examples: ▪ everyone was saddened by the news that housing is to be built on the fields beside cliff lane.
▪ those of us who knew him are shocked and saddened by his death.
it saddens somebody to do something: làm buồn ai đó khi làm gì
▪ sometimes it saddened him to think that he was no longer young.
it saddens somebody that : thật buồn rằng
▪ it saddens me that there are people who go around vandalizing public places like this.

children.name: depress
children.definition: /dɪˈpres/  to make someone feel very sad or unhappy, especially so that they feel that only bad things happen and they cannot change the situation:phiền muộn
examples: ▪ listening to the news can really depress you, if you let it.
▪ shaun decided to leave. the way the others were behaving was beginning to depress him.shaun quyết định ra đi.
it depresses somebody to do something: ai cảm thấy phiền muộn khi làm gì
▪ it depressed me to think that five years ago i was earning more than i do now.

children.name: get sb down
children.definition: get somebody down/ˌget somebody ˈdaʊn/  informal to gradually make someone feel unhappy and tired over a period of time:làm ai thất vọng
examples: ▪ the endless rain was beginning to get him down.
▪ you can tell me if there’s anything that’s worrying you or getting you down.

children.name: break sb’s heart
children.definition: break somebody’s heart/ˌbreɪk somebodyˈs ˈhɑːʳt/  to make someone very sad and upset, especially because a relationship has ended or because they are very disappointed:làm tan nát lòng ai
examples: ▪ when annie left him, it broke his heart.
it breaks somebody’s heart (that) ai đó cảm thấy tan nát cõi lòng khi
▪ it breaks my heart that his career has been ruined.
it breaks somebody’s heart to do something: ai đó cảm thấy đau lòng khi làm gì
▪ it would break her heart to leave the lovely old stone house where she’d lived for so long.

children.name: be a downer
children.definition: /biː ə ˈdaʊnəʳ/  spoken if something is a downer, it makes you feel unhappy, especially because it is not good or successful:chuyện không vui
examples: ▪ i thought the movie was going to be a total downer, but it wasn’t.
on a downer: là một chuyện không vui
▪ the home team concluded its season on a big downer with a 2- 0 defeat.

children.name: drive somebody to despair
children.definition: /ˌdraɪv somebody tə dɪˈspeəʳ/  to make someone feel very unhappy and without hope - use this especially when a bad situation is continuing and they cannot see how to change it:kiến ai tuyệt vọng
examples: ▪ there were times when the endless arguments drove him to despair.đã có những lúc các cuộc tranh cãi bất tận đã khiến ông phải thất vọng
▪ by the time i was 17, the atmosphere at the school was driving me to despair.

children.name: to feel sad and pity yourself
feel sorry for yourself
children.definition: /fiːl ˈsɒri fəʳ jɔːʳselfǁ-ˈsɑːri-/  especially spoken to spend a lot of time thinking about how unlucky you are or how unfairly you have been treated, in a way that annoys other people:cảm thông với ai
examples: ▪ stop blaming other people and feeling sorry for yourself..
▪ andy was drinking too much again, and feeling sorry for himself.

children.name: mope
children.definition: /məʊp/  to feel unhappy because of something bad that has happened, and to not be interested in doing anything, in a way that other people think is not reasonable:buồn rầu, sầu muộn
examples: ▪ don’t just lie there moping, waiting for the phone to ring.
mope around/about : buồn rầu, sầu muộn về chuyện gì
go around a place moping
▪ he’s not even attempting to look for a job -- he just mopes around the house all day.
mope over: buồn rầu về chuyện gì
▪ there’s no point moping over jane - she’s not worth it.

children.name: wallow in
children.definition: /ˈwɒləʊ ɪnǁˈwɑː-/ tuyệt vọng
examples: wallow in self-pity/despair/misery etc đắm mình trong sự thương hại/ tuyệt vọng/ đau khổ
to keep thinking about how unhappy you are, in a way that makes other people think that you are actually enjoying feeling sorry for yourself and do not want to feel happier:
▪ she told herself that she must try and learn from his criticism, rather than wallowing in self-pity.
▪ it’s no good wallowing in misery. you just have to get out there and find another job.

children.name: self-pity
children.definition: /ˌself ˈpɪti/  the feeling you have when you feel sorry for yourself, because you think that you have been very unlucky or that you have been treated unfairly:tự thương mình
examples: ▪ if you feel a wave of self-pity coming on, go and talk about it with friends.
▪ jenny told her story without any of the self-pity that i thought i would feel after such an ordeal.

children.name: sadness
children.definition: /ˈsædnɪs, ˈsædnəs/  a sad feeling, caused especially when a happy time is ending, or when you feel sorry about someone else’s unhappiness:buồn
examples: ▪ her eyes were full of sadness.đôi mắt cô đầy buồn bã
with (great) sadness: nỗi buồn rất lớn
▪ i remembered with great sadness all the friends i had left behind.
sense of sadness: cảm giác buồn
▪ after her death, charles felt a great sense of sadness and loss.sau cái chết của charles cảm thấy rất buồn bã và mất mác

children.name: unhappiness
children.definition: /ʌnˈhæpinɪs, ʌnˈhæpinəs/  the unhappy feeling you have when you are in a very difficult or unpleasant situation:không hạnh phúc
examples: ▪ after years of unhappiness, she finally decided to leave him.sau nhiều năm phiền muộn, cuối cùng cô quyết định rời bỏ anh ta
▪ there is no doubt that unhappiness contributes to ill health.
▪ you’ve no idea what unhappiness you cause your parents when you say that you want to leave home.

children.name: depression
children.definition: /dɪˈpreʃən/  a mental illness that makes someone feel so unhappy that they have no energy or hope for the future, and they cannot live a normal life:trầm cảm
examples: ▪ the family had a history of alcoholism and depression.gia đình này có tiền sử nghiện rượu và trầm cảm
▪ mild symptoms of anxiety and depression are often associated with social difficulties.các triệu chứng nhẹ của lo lắng và trầm cảm thường liên quan đến những khó khăn về xã hội
deep/severe depression: trầm cảm trầm trọng
▪ my father had suffered from severe depression for many years.cha tôi bị trầm cảm trầm trọng trong nhiều năm

children.name: the blues
children.definition: /ðə ˈbluːz/  a feeling of sadness that is not very serious, that you get sometimes for no particular reason:buồn
examples: get/have the blues: buồn
▪ i often get the blues in february, before the spring arrives..
a fit of the blues: rơi vào trạng thái trầm cảm
▪ it’s very common for new mothers to have a fit of the blues after giving birth.
the monday/post-christmas etc blues: ngày thứ hai buồn/giáng sinh buồn
▪ most people know what it’s like to have the monday morning blues.

children.name: misery
children.definition: /ˈmɪzəri/  great unhappiness, caused especially by living or working in very bad conditions:không hạnh phúc, đau khổ
examples: ▪ the high interest rates caused misery for millions of people.lãi suất cao gây ra sự khốn khổ cho hàng triệu người
the misery of something/somebody sự đau khổ của cái gì đó/ ai đó
▪ he talked openly about the misery of his marriage.
▪ we cannot ignore the misery of the people in this country who are forced to live on the streets.

children.name: melancholy
children.definition: /ˈmelənkəliǁ-kɑːli/  written a feeling of sadness, especially one that continues for a long time:buồn bã
examples: ▪ he was a strange man, prone to melancholy and bouts of drinking.
▪ jake was fourteen and suffering from adolescent melancholy.

children.name: sorrow
children.definition: /ˈsɒrəʊǁˈsɑː-, ˈsɔː-/  written the feeling of being very sad, especially because someone has died or because terrible things have happened to you:buồn
examples: deep/great sorrow: buồn sâu sắc
▪ the deep sorrow she felt was obvious in the expression of her face.
in sorrow: đang buồn
▪ he turned quickly away, more in sorrow than in anger.
to somebody’s sorrow: khiến ai buồn
▪ six weeks later we heard, to our great sorrow, that he had died..

children.name: heartache
children.definition: /ˈhɑːʳteɪk/  a feeling of unhappiness and worry, that often continues for a long time and is usually caused by problems in your personal life and relationships:sự đau khổ
examples: ▪ her relationship with tyler had brought her a great deal of heartache.
▪ being unpopular at school can cause real heartache to children of any age.
save/spare (somebody) a lot of heartache: làm cho ai hết lo lắng buồn bã
stop someone worrying and feeling unhappy
▪ if she had simply called them, her parents would have been spared a lot of heartache.

children.name: despondency
children.definition: /dɪˈspɒndənsiǁ-ˈspɑːn-/  formal a feeling of unhappiness, especially because you have been very disappointed and feel that you cannot change a situation:thất vọng
examples: ▪ robyn walked away from the hospital with a feeling of despondency
▪ the sense of well-being of the 1980s was replaced by a mood of despondency.
gloom/doom and despondency: buồn và chán nản
▪ the atmosphere amongst the workers was one of gloom and despondency.

children.name: despair
children.definition: /dɪˈspeəʳ/  a feeling of great unhappiness, because very bad things have happened and you have no hope that anything will change:tuyệt vọng, đau lòng
examples: ▪ i could see hunger, exhaustion and despair in their eyes.tôi có thể nhìn thấy cái đói, kiệt sức và tuyệt vọng trong mắt họ.
▪ there was a mood of despair about the quality of urban and industrial life
in despair: trong tuyệt vọng
▪ left all alone in her room, she was in despair.để cô ấy một mình trong phòng, cô ấy đang rất tuyệt vọng.
the depths of despair: tận cùng của tuyệt vọng
▪ it seems that he had reached the depths of despair, and he finally took his own life.dường như ông đã đạt đến mức sâu thẳm của sự tuyệt vọng và cuối cùng ông đã tự tử

children.name: to make sb feel less sad
cheer sb up
children.definition: cheer somebody up/ˌtʃɪəʳ somebody ˈʌp/  to make someone feel happier when they are disappointed or sad about something:làm ai đó vui lên, an ủi
examples: ▪ is there anything we can do to cheer you up?
▪ she failed her test, so i’m taking her out to cheer her up.

children.name: comfort
children.definition: /ˈkʌmfəʳt/  to make someone feel less upset by being kind to them and telling them not to worry:làm thoải mái hơn
examples: ▪ bill stroked her hair gently, trying to comfort her.
▪ we did our best to comfort him, but he was obviously very upset.

children.name: cheer up
children.definition: /ˌtʃɪər ˈʌp/  spoken say this to tell someone to stop feeling disappointed or sad and try to be more cheerful:làm ai vui lên
examples: ▪ cheer up, phil! it’s only a game, and you can’t win every time.cạn ly.
▪ cheer up! it’s not the end of the world.cạn ly!

children.name: it’s all right/it’s ok
children.definition: /ɪts ˌɔːl ˈraɪt, ɪts ˌəʊ ˈkeɪ/ spoken say this to make someone feel calmer or make them stop crying, when they are very upset and worried about something:ổn rồi
examples: ▪ it’s all right, honey, i’m here now.không sao , em yêu, anh ở đây
